channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: 22 new cases in Victoria; where have cases increased?

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australians download COVIDSafe app more than 4.5 million times, global COVID-19 cases climb past 3.5 million as nation's death toll stands at 96

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: After weeks of discussion, Rugby Australia has sent its 'Return to Play Manual' away for government approval in the hope of a July resumption for its domestic competition.
item.title: Rugby Australia submits biosecurity plans to government

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The prudential regulator has been riding banks and insurers hard over the past month and it left lenders very little wriggle room when it came to dividend policy.
item.title: How APRA hijacked bank dividend policy

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Western Australia's bullish stance on border closure remains one of the stumbling blocks for the AFL as it moves closer to restarting the 2020 season.
item.title: Return to play, but what about WA?

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne says players must learn to adapt if potential new hygiene rules lead to a ban on sweat and saliva being used to shine the ball.
item.title: Saliva ban won't take shine off game, says Labuschagne

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australian intelligence agencies are struggling to find the evidence trumpeted by the United States that supposedly pins the coronavirus on a Wuhan laboratory.
item.title: Australian intelligence knocks back US government's Wuhan lab virus claim

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: House removalists moved one of two homes onto a truck to be sent to the Scenic Rim.
item.title: Changing face of an inner-city Brisbane suburb raises concerns

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Online meetings will replace the typical council chamber meeting on Tuesday.
item.title: Brisbane councillors zoom to work while warned to watch their apps

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Updated mapping based off census data shows particular south-east Queensland suburbs may be in for a rougher ride than others.
item.title: How south-east Queensland is predicted to cope with job losses

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queenslanders have been shown what the path to recovery from coronavirus looks like, but dangers still lurk between here and the "ambitious" June target.
item.title: ‘Ambitious’ plan to reopen Queensland depends on no new virus cases

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Authorities are investigating the possibility a previously identified employee was not the initial source of the outbreak.
item.title: NSW Health investigating possible multiple infection sources at Newmarch House

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Cameron Smith grew a beard and embraced being a home-school teacher during the NRL's hiatus but is back to his job as a footballer with the Storm to begin training in Albury this week.
item.title: Smith turns from tutor to skipper as Storm head to Albury

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: Both an annual meteor shower and a more unexpected visitor will be visible over Melbourne and the rest of Victoria over the next two mornings.
item.title: 'Bonanza' for early-rising stargazers in Melbourne

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Tougher privacy laws will be put to Parliament next week in a bid to jail anyone who breaches the safeguards in Australia's new coronavirus tracing app.
item.title: Jail terms for those who breach COVID app privacy law

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: Konrad Frost, 39, was the man's fifth victim, stabbed while he was waiting outside the South Hedland Shopping Centre.
item.title: South Hedland stabbing victim's family tell of devastation as he remains in ICU

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Top jockey Steven Pateman is free to take up his rides at the Warrnambool carnival after racing authorities 'reserved' a decision on penalty for a cobalt charge.
item.title: Pateman escapes immediate punishment for cobalt charge

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: All the Souths star wanted was to hug his teammates after 42 days of no football or training - and the code's young loved-up stars will also be denied affection.
item.title: Damien Cook longs for hugs as young stars farewell girlfriends

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Mother-of-two Natalie Smith wants to move home because of ongoing maintenance problems at her Mernda rental, but her real estate agent said she would have to prove financial hardship.
item.title: 'We're stuck here': Flawed laws under review as tenants' problems mount

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Westpac chief executive Peter King says the severity of the COVID-19 economic shock will be the key factor in determining the bank's dividend policy.
item.title: Bad loans key to Westpac dividend as payout suspended

item.description: Announcing a new plan to bring its business model into line with the Paris climate accord, Westpac has announced it will end funding for thermal coal mining.
item.title: Westpac abandons funding for thermal coal mining

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: The ASX-listed chicken producer Ingham's says the boost from panic buying at supermarkets has stopped.
item.title: Chicken giant Ingham's cites 'unprecedented challenges' from COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: A week after breaking social distancing rules, Latrell Mitchell has been sent to undergo a COVID-19 test after showing flu-like symptoms when he fronted South Sydney training.
item.title: Mitchell tested for coronavirus after being turned away from training

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The three flights from Delhi, costing $2300 a ticket and each carrying 188 passengers, sold out within about 20 minutes.
item.title: Three Qantas flights to pick up Aussies stranded in India

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW Transport Minister Andrew Constance will contest the federal seat of Eden-Monaro.
item.title: Transport Minister Andrew Constance will contest Eden-Monaro

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Some restrictions on our lives look set to be eased as the pandemic curve flattens. But vigilance concerning this virus cannot be replaced with complacency.
item.title: Early easing of restrictions a test for our self-discipline

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Geelong surveys members to try to determine how many they will keep if all footy this year is played behind closed doors.
item.title: Work with us: Cats make plea to fans

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: Students from practical courses like arts, music and vet medicine want fee discounts, arguing 'trying to play in orchestras via Zoom' while paying full fees is unfair.
item.title: Uni students bemoan impossibilities of online learning

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Sydney's universities are working on how to return students to campus, but warn that big lectures are still a long way off.
item.title: Universities plan student return, but big lectures still distant

item.description: With many companies on Wall Street pulling guidance, the latest episode of The Short Squeeze takes a look at US reporting season.
item.title: The Short Squeeze: Markets are missing a key ingredient

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Online harm has risen by 40 per cent during the COVID-19 pandemic, including a 21 per cent rise in youth cyber-bullying.
item.title: Parents advised to step up involvement in children's online lives

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The man contacted friends after experiencing difficulties on the kayak.
item.title: Queensland man rescued from sinking kayak

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The law firm claims they have evidence of “tens of thousands of Australians being short-changed by major airlines, travel agents and tour companies” due to COVID-19 cancellations.
item.title: Flight Centre's cancellation fee backflip could cost $80 million

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: The buy now pay later operator's stock is back in rude health as the entry of new investor Tencent raises possibility of an expansion into China.
item.title: Afterpay soars above pandemic concerns with Tencent deal

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: A worker from a Melbourne abattoir closed due to a coronavirus outbreak sparked a COVID-19 scare at Sunshine Hospital after he tested positive while being treated for a severed thumb.
item.title: Meat worker at centre of abattoir cluster sparked Sunshine Hospital scare

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: A suite of changes to give employers including McDonald's and Domino's more flexibility has prompted one union to accuse another of undermining job security.
item.title: Fast food pay agreement changes spark union fight

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: authorities hand out more than $2m in fines for breaching restrictions so far

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: NBL owner Larry Kestelman is optimistic about having imports next season and he won't hesitate to delay the start of next season if fans can't attend games.
item.title: We won't start the season with no crowds: Kestelman

item.dc:creator: Aja Styles
item.description: The chief judge of the District Court was farewelled in the state’s first ever virtual ceremony as a man with a sense of humour and penchant for ’70s rock music.
item.title: Behind the judicial robes beats the heart of a '70s music lover

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Transurban is preparing to buy or fund new toll roads it says governments will need to spur economic recovery, but signalled it could come at the cost of lower dividend payouts.
item.title: Transurban revs up for coronavirus recovery investment spree

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: This week the state will move on to calling its final few witnesses, which includes Detective Senior Sergeant Joseph Marrapodi, who is a long-serving Macro Taskforce member.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: Homicide pattern experts called to strengthen case for Sarah Spiers' murder

item.description: Stockman lines up in a class 1 handicap at Hawkesbury nearly three weeks after a ripping return at Goulburn, where he exploded home from well back to claim his maiden.
item.title: Stock rising: Bigger prizes down the track for promising gelding

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an eight-race card at Hawkesbury.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Hawkesbury on Tuesday

item.description: Playing State of Origin at the end of the year "keeps the integrity" of the coronavirus-hit NRL season, Brisbane coach Anthony Seibold says.
item.title: End-of-year Origin makes sense: Seibold

item.description: And if mysteries from the UK aren't your thing, don't worry – there's plenty on TV to keep you entertained this week.
item.title: Twisting British thriller is the stuff of any parent's nightmares (and it's really, really good)

item.description: Former US Green Beret called on Venezuelans to join the movement, saying people "are ready to flip. They just need a catalyst."
item.title: Former US Green Beret linked to 'invasion' of Venezuela

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Travellers could fly between Australia and New Zealand without undergoing quarantine under talks between the NZ Prime Minister and Australian leaders.
item.title: Trans-Tasman flights on the agenda when Jacinda Ardern joins national cabinet

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: The pandemic has set fire to WA's already struggling retail trade sector, with thousands of stores closed, especially along Perth's food and beverage heavy retail strips.
item.title: Coronavirus destroys WA's retail strips and shopping centres with almost two-thirds of stores closed

item.description: Visits to anyone with whom one has "a stable bond of affection" will permitted - leaving many wondering whether they were allowed to meet friends or lovers.
item.title: Italy's rules for life and love after lockdown a confusing 'patchwork'
